title: Pearl barley risotto with asparagus

ingredients.content: 1 brown onion (approx. 150 g), cut into quarters
1 - 2 tsp Meat stock paste, or Vegetable stock paste (see Tips)
50 g Parmesan cheese, cut into cubes (3 cm)
1 leek (approx. 110 g), white part only, cut into quarters
2 tsp Meat stock paste, or Vegetable stock paste (see Tips)
6 raw baby beetroots, peeled and cut into quarters
1 bunch asparagus, trimmed and cut into pieces (4 cm)
1 pinch ground black pepper, to taste

preparations.content: Place brown onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add all remaining reduction ingredients and cook <b>15 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place leek into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and butter and sauté <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Add barley and verjuice and sauté <b>2 min/100°C//speed <b>.
Add water and stock paste to mixing bowl, then place Varoma dish into position and place beetroot into it. Secure Varoma lid and cook <b>10 min/Varoma//speed <b>.
Insert Varoma tray, then place carrots onto it. Secure Varoma lid and cook <b>10 min/Varoma//speed <b>.
Add asparagus to Varoma tray, then secure Varoma lid and cook for a further <b>5 min/Varoma//speed <b>.
Ensure all vegetables are cooked to your liking, if necessary cook for a further <b>5 min/Varoma//speed <b>. Remove Varoma and set aside.

<b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Transfer risotto into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, then stir through reserved grated Parmesan and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve barley risotto topped with steamed vegetables, drizzled with red wine reduction.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the Vegetable and Meat stock paste recipes.
Verjuice is an acidic juice made by pressing unripened grapes. It can be found in specialty delicatessens. Substitute dry white wine for a slightly different flavour.
